newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - Evening Standard - May 13.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Evening Standard - May 13.

text.p: Prepared for Reuters by The Broadcast Monitoring Company

Safety in the channel tunnel was condemned by Fire chiefs today, who called for new measures to protect passengers. Their demands include the separation of car drivers and passengers from their vehicles aboard Le Shuttle and the removal of all lattice-sided freight wagons.
SIB ACTS TO CLEAR PENSIONS BLOCKAGE

In order to help clear up the pensions mis-selling fiasco, the Securities and Investments Board has set out guidelines on how compensation payments can be made. The main thrust of the SIB initiative is to set out the conditions firms must comply by if they are to pay individual compensation packages into personal pension schemes.

The Consumers' Association in a hardhitting internal document argues that the government's proposed new windfall tax could increase the risk that consumers do not get value for money and possibly throw out much needed reform of utility industry regulation.
PRINCE SNAPS UP 25 MLN STAKE IN CORDIANT
Saudi Prince Alwaleed Bin Talal has just bought a 3 percent share in troubled advertising group Cordiant. He has just spent 25mn stg buying the shares on the open market.
